text: do you know the Arctic is such a
difficult place to work but the animals
that live there are so well adapted to
living in this really harsh extreme
environment I would love to know how
they do it how do they know when to
migrate and where to migrate why do they
they sing I study bowhead whale song and
and we still don't quite know why they
sing or what what the point is and why
they're they're so diverse in their song
and just how do they and all marine
mammals really how do they navigate
their environment and what are the

and how our changes in the environment
potentially affecting those cues and
maybe you know if the ice opens up
earlier and their internal clock tells
them they need to migrate say in April
but the ice is open up in March and in

phytoplankton which are small plants
that feed the zooplankton which are
small animals that the whales feed
suppose they missed that whole bloom
because they're a little bit late
because the environments changed how
will that affect the animals or will it
can they can they tell are they I mean
there's certainly better oceanographers

good meteorologists
